description.narrative: On 5 August 2009 the inter-island ferry Princess Ashika sank off the Tongan coast. The MV Princess Ashika was recently purchased by the Tongan Government to provide inter-island passenger services following the decommissioning of the old ferry and prior to the arrival of a new ferry being donated by Japan. The expected delivery date for the Japanese-funded ferry is December 2010. Funding under this initiative provides temporary support to the Government of Tonga to maintain maritime transport services and to work with regional organisations and national authorities to strengthen maritime safety in the Pacific. The total value of this initiative is $2.0 million over 3 years, starting 2009-10.
